content: stitch between each section or you can just count time to start crocheting into the chain chain 3 counts as first double_crochet double_crochet into the fifth chain from the hook double_crochet into each chain until you reach the first marker in the marked stitch do an increase of 1 double_crochet chain 2 1 double_crochet continue to double_crochet between markers and increase at each marked stitch until you get to the end 4 increases turn for each subsequent row just double_crochet into each stitch until you get to the increase from the previous row make sure you double_crochet into the double_crochet s that make up the sides of the increase this makes your increase for the new row and 1 double_crochet chain 2 1 double_crochet into the chain 2 space measure the height across the row after each row when the height equals the shoulder measurement you took way back it s time to make the sleeves measure the current width of the sleeve section compare this number to the arm circumference measurement if the sleeve width is smaller than the arm circumference record the difference start the next row and double_crochet until you get to the first increase and make a chain that is equal to the difference measurement you just took join the end of the chain at the second increase and continue on repeat to join the third and fourth increases you now have two sleeves continue to double_crochet on the body part including into the chains you made without increases until the shrug reaches your desired length fasten_off rejoin at a sleeve double_crochet around until it is long enough for you repeat on the other sleeve for a tidy finish single_crochet around the body or add any edging you like wash block and you re done
